intro: Gonioma kamassi, commonly known as the Cameroon starleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels. Gonioma kamassi is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
